intro: Crepis leontodontoides, commonly known as the golden hawk's-bill, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, hairy growth habit and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, dandelion-like yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
